Original question:
For a cell constructed with a Cu (s) | Cu2+ (aq) anode and Ag+
 (aq) | Ag (s) cathode at 25.0°C. Calculate the cell potential at 25.0°C under non-standard conditions:
[Cu2+] = 0.300 M and [ Ag+] = 0.0500 M. (E° for Cu2+ (aq) + 2e-
 ⇒ Cu(s) is 0.34 volts and E° for Ag+ (aq) + 1e- → Ag (s) is 0.80 volts)
